page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: Milnrow is situated off the busy Lancashire-Yorkshire{motorway,}the M62,which was opened by the Queen on October 14th 1971. The route taken by the motorway was chosen carefully so that hopefully, it could be kept open even in the worst weather conditions. Parts are exposed and it suffers from snow drifts and high winds. The route includes{Rakewood Viaduct}which is 14O ft. high and has six spans of between 12O and 15O ft.. There is a junction onto the motorway at Milnrow with a motorway compound in the loop of the slip road. A by-pass around the village was built at the same time as the motorway. Milnrow and Newhey have{rail}links via Rochdale or Oldham with Manchester The stations are unmanned.
